content.title: Women Involvement in Science and Engineering Research
content.beneficiary: Women researchers in India and Germany
content.details: The scheme 'Women Involvement in Science and Engineering Research (WISER)' aims to build scientific capacity, retain and promote women researchers in India & Germany by utilising complementary expertise in science, technology, innovation and research partnerships. This scheme is designed for women researchers holding a regular/long-term research position in academia/research institute/industry in India or Germany.
benefits: Basic project assistance including research staff for the Indian awardee, consumables, and contingency.
One-month research stay in the host country including single round-trip airfare, visa fee, medical insurance, and per diem for the stay.
eligibility: The applicant must be working either in India or Germany.
Women researchers/entrepreneurs holding regular positions in academic/research institutions/industrial research organizations in India/Germany may apply.
The programme is open to all areas of STEM.
documents_required: No Objection Certificate (NOC)/Endorsement letter from the head of the institution (present organization)
Details of any other Notable Achievements

faqs.question: What is the WISER programme?
faqs.answer: Women Involvement in Science and Engineering Research (WISER) aims to promote women researchers in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) to join an ongoing R&D+I project without applying for a fresh project grant.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for WISER?
faqs.answer: Women holding a regular/long-term research position in academia/research institute/industry either in India or Germany.

faqs.question: What is the tenure of the grant?
faqs.answer: The tenure of the grant is for 3 years or till completion of the project whichever is earlier.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Applications are accepted throughout the year and eligible candidates can apply online.
